page.title: 16Historical Houses
page.content: and people may have said "We are going to Cryke's". The Strutt family live at Crix at the moment. A priory was built in the village in the eleventh century although the original priory no longer exists. In the eighteenth century John Wright , a famous coach builder, bought the old priory, knocked it down and built a fashionable new house in the grounds. He had the grounds made into a beautiful country estate by a landscape gardener. Mr. and Mrs. Cowell bought the priory a few years ago and are in the process of restoring it to exactly what it was like when it was built in the eighteenth century. They are restoring the gardens too.
